text: Hello, we are testing calls using our integration, with the new calls feature we can't call contact without register a phone number as we use to do.

Hello, all!
Please tell me how can I get my HubSpot account name (or entire profile) via API v3? I didn't find an answer in the documentation.
Thanx at advance.

Hi All, I am a user of HubSpot. I notice my code has problem creating contact that is not in HubSpot. The issue is like this, trying to find a contact phone number in HubSpot and when it cannot find the contact id vid in the response the code will attempt to create the contact and use the new contact id for engagement. but i notice that when the code search for the same number for the second time about 1 second later there is no vid coming back so my code attempts to create the same number for the second time.
is there a racing effect when creating the contact in 1 second intervals

This will generally always be a problem with distributed systems, especially with replication. You should ideally resolve this in your code by maintaining some sort of local reference of contacts created based on a unique id. If HubSpot returns a success respond with an ID when you create the contact - simply store in an local hashmap with email as identifier, or something similar.

When you say search are you referring to the search endpoint? If so - this, i imagine is more likely to be slower to update as itâ€™ll be using a search index I imagine.

Following up on the feedback from <@UNDQNU056>and <@U01RPV7FWQZ>, I noticed yesterday (Monday) that `profile-url` is also no longer included in webhook payloads. Was this change intentional? Trying to decide if we need to rewrite our integrations to derive the profile URL another way.

Hi all, I'm trying to add an option of making a call using an App on a CRM record page.  Documentation suggests using local storage to store a LocalSettings:Sales:CallingExtensions value.  This worked for me a few weeks ago, but no longer works.  Have there been any changes/updates recently that could cause this?
Hey <@U01RPV7FWQZ> and <@UNDQNU056>, according to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog/profile-token-value-is-being-removed|changelog>, this is working as designed
I am not referring to the 'profile-token'. I am referring to the 'profile-url'. It's a specifically different key.
<@UD53A9UUR> I am not referring to the 'profile-token'. I am referring to the 'profile-url'. It's a specifically different key.
my bad :faceplam: .  let me take a look
:slightly_smiling_face: no worries. Thanks for looking.

Hi everyone,
Does anyone know a way to have a button on the CRM Card to refresh the data on the card? Would having an action button post to the card api again work?

So the profile-url is dependent upon the profile-token.  So this is working as designed.
However, we should have been more explicit about it and i do apologize about the confusion
ok - so it's definitely not coming back then. Great! if the portalid was returned then creating the url would not be too tough
This url structure should work for you `<https://app.HubSpot.com/contacts/:hubid/contact/:vid>` I am thinking
I think the hubid is not part of the profile response
beautiful! thanks
:slightly_smiling_face: n
also, i will work to get that doc example updated and remove what is not really there
thanks for clarifying
